alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bledsoe County through 700 PM CST... At 614 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Spencer to 10 miles northwest of Dunlap. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pikeville, Palio, Brayton, Melvine, Mount Crest, Old Cumberland and Fall Creek Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
